title: BoxConstraints has a negative minimum height.
body:
<!-- Thank you for using Flutter!

     If you are looking for support, please check out our documentation
     or consider asking a question on Stack Overflow:
      * https://flutter.dev/
      * https://api.flutter.dev/
      * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/flutter?sort=frequent

     If you have found a bug or if our documentation doesn't have an answer
     to what you're looking for, then fill out the template below. Please read
     our guide to filing a bug first: https://flutter.dev/docs/resources/bug-reports
-->

## Steps to Reproduce

<!-- Please include full steps to reproduce so that we can reproduce the problem. -->

Execute `flutter run` on the code sample <!-- (see "Code sample" section below) -->
Tap on the `Sign In` button to see the error

**Expected results:** <!-- what did you want to see? -->
The form would be validated 
**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->
TextFormField overlaps and there is an error stated below:


```
════════ Exception caught by rendering library ═════════════════════════════════

BoxConstraints has a negative minimum height.

These invalid constraints were provided to RenderCustomPaint's layout() function by the following function, which probably computed the invalid constraints in question:
_RenderDecoration.performLayout
package:flutter/…/material/input_decorator.dart:1308

The offending constraints were: BoxConstraints(w=253.3, h=-2.3; NOT NORMALIZED)
The relevant error-causing widget was
TextFormField
lib\error_page.dart:128
```

title: What is the alternative for "initState()` while we using "GetX" and "statelessWidget"?
[pigeon] Add correctly named convenience constructors for ObjC classes

labels.name: package
labels.description: flutter/packages repository. See also p: labels.

labels.name: pigeon
labels.description: related to pigeon messaging codegen tool

labels.name: P4
labels.description: Priority 4 issue (default for bugs, things we're likely to work on)

body:
(See https://github.com/flutter/plugins/pull/4726#discussion_r798193433 for background)

Currently pigeon makes data classes in ObjC with convenience constructors starting with `make`. E.g.:
```
@interface FLTTextureMessage : NSObject
+ (instancetype)makeWithTextureId:(nullable NSNumber *)textureId;
```

The ObjC naming convention for convenience constructors is to use the class name, since that's what's being returned. So for the above, the correct name would be `textureMessageWithTextureId:`. While we can't remove the `make...` versions without a breaking change, we can:
- Start generating the correct version in addition.
- Leave the `make` version as a forwarding method whole implementation is just to call the new method.
- Mark the `make` version as deprecated.

title: Flutter should expose text editing shortcut logic for reuse
body:
Flutter has a ton of logic for handling keyboard shortcuts in the framework, mapping them in [default_text_editing_shortcuts.dart](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/master/packages/flutter/lib/src/widgets/default_text_editing_shortcuts.dart) and actually handling them privately [in editable_text.dart](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/4b82d47b012380ed952ab29e66033f62a3bcda84/packages/flutter/lib/src/widgets/editable_text.dart#L3105).  We should make this logic reusable by developers writing their own text editors.

## Why?

Previously, this logic was exposed in a class called `TextEditingActionTarget`, but that was removed in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/90684.  It was brought up in the [comments](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/90684#issuecomment-1029312785) after merge that this change had broken two major text editing projects.

Besides being impractical for developers to reimplement all of this logic on their own, doing so would quickly get out of sync with Flutter's behavior and cause strange discrepancies in text editing behavior between simple TextFields and the custom text editors.

## How?

The shortcuts and their behavior is already overridable by using Shortcuts and Actions widgets, but the problem is applying them to something other than an EditableText.  This was possible by mixing in `TextEditingActionTarget`, but it was brought up in the comments that [a composable solution may be preferred](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/90684#issuecomment-1029697048) instead.

We should flesh out this idea and then expose it publicly.

title: Material 3 Typography support.

labels.name: team
labels.description: Infra upgrades, team productivity, code health, technical debt. See also team: labels.

labels.name: framework
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter repository. See also f: labels.

labels.name: f: material design
labels.description: flutter/packages/flutter/material repository.

body: As part of the [Material 3 migration](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/91605), this PR adds support for the M3 typography text styles and themes: This adds a new Typography constructor: `Typography.material2021` that will provide a set of text themes that match the [Material 3 spec](https://m3.material.io/styles/typography/tokens). Also if a `ThemeData` is constructed without specifying the `typography` parameter and `useMaterial3` is true, it will use `Typography.material2021`. Otherwise, it will use the usual default of `Typography.material2014`. New tests were added to check the values of the new text themes as well as the `useMaterial3` settings. This addresses part of #89853.

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. See standard-version for commit guidelines.

3.0.0 (2021-09-27)

⚠ BREAKING CHANGES

  • input parameter names have changed

    Rename the following input parameters when upgrading from v2 to v3:

    • issue-lock-inactive-days --> issue-inactive-days
    • issue-exclude-created-before --> exclude-issue-created-before
    • issue-exclude-labels --> exclude-any-issue-labels

body:
Bumps [github/codeql-action](https://github.com/github/codeql-action) from 1.0.26 to 1.0.31.
Changelog

Sourced from github/codeql-action's changelog.

CodeQL Action and CodeQL Runner Changelog

[UNRELEASED]

  • Add sarif-id as an output for the upload-sarif and analyze actions. #889
  • Add ref and sha inputs to the analyze action, which override the defaults provided by the GitHub Action context. #889

1.0.31 - 31 Jan 2022

  • Remove experimental message when using custom CodeQL packages. #888
  • Add a better warning message stating that experimental features will be disabled if the workflow has been triggered by a pull request from a fork or the security-events: write permission is not present. #882

1.0.30 - 24 Jan 2022

  • Display a better error message when encountering a workflow that runs the codeql-action/init action multiple times. #876
  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.7.6. #877

1.0.29 - 21 Jan 2022

  • The feature to wait for SARIF processing to complete after upload has been disabled by default due to a bug in its interaction with pull requests from forks.

1.0.28 - 18 Jan 2022

  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.7.5. #866
  • Fix a bug where SARIF files were failing upload due to an invalid test for unique categories. #872

1.0.27 - 11 Jan 2022

  • The analyze and upload-sarif actions will now wait up to 2 minutes for processing to complete after they have uploaded the results so they can report any processing errors that occurred. This behavior can be disabled by setting the wait-for-processing action input to "false". #855

1.0.26 - 10 Dec 2021

  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.7.3. #842

1.0.25 - 06 Dec 2021

No user facing changes.

1.0.24 - 23 Nov 2021

  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.7.2. #827

1.0.23 - 16 Nov 2021

  • The upload-sarif action now allows multiple uploads in a single job, as long as they have different categories. #801
  • Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.7.1. #816

1.0.22 - 04 Nov 2021

  • The init step of the Action now supports ram and threads inputs to limit resource use of CodeQL extractors. These inputs also serve as defaults to the subsequent analyze step, which finalizes the database and executes queries. #738

title: `SwapBuffers` can be called multiple times in the same frame interval

labels.name: engine
labels.description: flutter/engine repository. See also e: labels.

body:
Current behaviro is that, The rasterizer will queue a task to handle the next work item if there are more items in the pipeline: https://github.com/flutter/engine/blob/main/shell/common/rasterizer.cc#L213. The vsync timing drives requests for production of new frames that are ultimately fed into the rasterizer pipeline. There isn't any coordination between the rasterizer's frame consumption and the vsync timing.

Is there any good reason to allow that? If we are successful in rendering the second frame we spent useless cycles rendering the first frame, if not we are potentially eating away at the next frame's raster time. cc: @chinmaygarde 

Here is an example of one such instance:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1006071/152583511-85637e2d-bc1d-4451-b81d-c62b567fcf15.png)

labels.description: Priority 4 issue (default for bugs, things we're likely to work on)

body:
The following autogenerated mock method:

```dart
  void requestFullscreen() =>
      super.noSuchMethod(Invocation.method(#requestFullscreen, []),
          returnValueForMissingStub: null);
```

Has had its API recently changed, [in `dart:html`, here](https://github.com/dart-lang/sdk/commit/4c64181d73bdbb36d365c135d82556b722aafd28))

It is causing build errors in the latest `master` like so:

```
org-dartlang-app:///webview_flutter_web_test.mocks.dart:933:8: Error: The return type of the method 'MockIFrameElement.requestFullscreen' is 'void', which does not match the return type, 'Future<void>', of the overridden method, 'Element.requestFullscreen'.
 - 'Future' is from 'dart:async'.
Change to a subtype of 'Future<void>'.
  void requestFullscreen() =>
       ^
org-dartlang-sdk:///dart-sdk/lib/html/dart2js/html_dart2js.dart: Context: This is the overridden method ('requestFullscreen').
org-dartlang-app:///webview_flutter_web_test.mocks.dart:933:8: Error: The method 'MockIFrameElement.requestFullscreen' has fewer positional arguments than those of overridden method 'Element.requestFullscreen'.
  void requestFullscreen() =>
       ^
org-dartlang-sdk:///dart-sdk/lib/html/dart2js/html_dart2js.dart: Context: This is the overridden method ('requestFullscreen').
Failed to compile
```

**Regenerate the `webview_flutter_web_test.mocks.dart` once the above Dart commit makes it to Flutter stable.**

(Clean [this](https://github.com/flutter/plugins/pull/4736/files#diff-93d1ba1a0c57370abd2adb5b6c418d6675bca39148c6c49c46c3033549886e61R932-R933))

title: Windows Desktop build saving build file "app.so" in wrong folder
body:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Create new Flutter App
2. Run Flutter App on Desktop without changing anything
3. Gets Error "Can't load AOT data from ..\build\windows\runner\Debug\data\app.so no such file."

## Issue Discovered
1. Found that the app.so is being placed in the build\windows folder

## Steps Taken Already
1. Tried running in chrome as web app, works without issue
2. Moved the app.so manually to the correct location, works without issue, but rebuilds make a new app.so in the wrong location

Expected results: Application Running

Actual results: Crashes Looking for app.so file

title: flutter test --reporter json includes Android embedding v1 deprecation warning
body:
## Steps to Reproduce

1. Setup Android project with flutter <= 1.12
2. Update to flutter 2.10.0
3. run `flutter test --reporter json > test-results.json`

**Expected results:**

Test report contains only valid json representing the test results

OR When running either one

* `flutter --ignore-deprecation test --reporter json > test-results.json`
* `flutter test --ignore-deprecation --reporter json > test-results.json`

Test report contains only valid json representing the test results

**Actual results:** <!-- what did you see? -->

Test results are preceded by this warning

```
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
Warning
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Your Flutter application is created using an older version of the Android
embedding. It is being deprecated in favor of Android embedding v2. Follow the
steps at

https://flutter.dev/go/android-project-migration

to migrate your project. You may also pass the --ignore-deprecation flag to
ignore this check and continue with the deprecated v1 embedding. However,
the v1 Android embedding will be removed in future versions of Flutter.
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
The detected reason was:

  <path to project>/android/app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml uses `android:name="io.flutter.app.FutterApplication"`
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
```

When running either of 

* `flutter --ignore-deprecation test --reporter json > test-results.json`
* `flutter test --ignore-deprecation --reporter json > test-results.json`

```
Could not find an option named "ignore-deprecation".

Run 'flutter -h' (or 'flutter <command> -h') for available flutter commands and options.
```

Might be related to: Flutter Test should support multiple reporters #69425

## Workaround

If you encounter this problem as well, here's my workaround

`flutter test --reporter json | grep '^{' > test-results.json`

This works because flutter's json reporter stores the test results as a valid json object per line and each json object must start with a `{`, and no line of the warning starts with `{ `

body:
fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/64918

This provide a way control popmenu size constraints similar to IconButton's constraints parameter

This is particularly useful for when user doesn't get constrained by the values and made the popupmnenu as wide as possible.
